rows.description: State dealer license required for sale of all firearms
State dealer license required for handgun sales
Record keeping and retention required for all private sellers and all licensed dealers for all firearms
Record keeping and retention required for all sellers and all dealers for handgun sales
Record keeping and retention required for licensed dealers for all firearm sales
Record keeping and retention required for licensed dealers for handgun sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for all private sellers and all licensed dealers for all firearms
Reporting of sales records to the state required for all sellers and all dealers for handgun sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for licensed dealers for all firearm sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for licensed dealers for handgun sales
State is not required to purge sales records for at least 60 days after purchase
Ban on residential dealers
Mandatory theft reporting for all firearms
At least one store security precaution required
Mandatory police inspections
Strict liability for damages resulting from illegal gun sales
Ban on junk guns (sometimes called "Saturday night specials")
Waiting period is required on all firearm purchases from dealers
Waiting period is required on all handgun purchases from dealers
A license or permit is required to purchase all firearms
A license or permit is required to purchase handguns
Fingerprinting required at point of purchase for all dealers
Safety training or testing required prior to issuing a firearm license or permit
Permit process involves law enforcement
Purchase of handguns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 21 and older
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 18 and older
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers restricted to age 21 and older
Purchase of long guns from licensed dealers and private sellers restricted to age 21 and older
Mandatory reporting of lost and stolen guns by firearm owners
One handgun per month with no or limited exceptions
Felony conviction is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Involuntary commitment (inpatient) is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Involuntary commitment (outpatient) is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Firearm purchase/possession prohibited if person deemed by court to be danger to oneself or others
Drug misdemeanor is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Recent treatment for alcohol-related reasons is prohibitive for firearm purchase/possession
Firearm purchase/possession is prohibited for some people with alcoholism
Universal background checks required at point of transfer for all firearms
Universal background check required at point of transfer for handguns
Background checks required for all gun show firearm sales at point of purchase
Background checks required for purchase of handguns at gun shows at point of purchase
Background checks conducted through permit requirement for all firearm sales (or universal background checks)
Background checks conducted through permit requirement for all handgun sales (or universal background checks)
State is not required to purge background check records for at least 60 days
Background checks for gun sales or permits have more than a three-day limit in which they must be completed
Required background checks include an explicit requirement for search of state mental health records
State conducts separate background checks, beyond the federal NICS check, for all firearms
State conducts separate background checks, beyond the federal NICS check, for handguns
Vendor license required to sell ammunition
Ammunition purchaser records must be retained
Permit required to purchase ammunition
Sale of ammunition is restricted to all the same categories as firearms
Ammunition sales not allowed to persons under age 18 for any type of ammunition (all firearms)
Ammunition sales not allowed to persons under age 21 for handguns
Background checks required for ammunition purchase
No possession of handguns until age 21
No possession of long guns until age 18
No possession of long guns until age 21
No gun carrying allowed on college campuses
No gun carrying on college campuses, including concealed weapons permittees
No gun carrying on elementary school property, including concealed weapons permittees
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
"May issue" state
Applicants are required to make a heightened showing to obtain a concealed carry permit
Concealed carry permit process requires a background check
Concealed carry permit renewal requires a new background check
Authorities are required to revoke concealed carry permits under certain circumstances

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Assault weapons sales ban beyond just assault pistols

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Assault weapons defined by only one feature

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Assault weapons included in a list of banned weapons

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Grandfathered weapons must be registered

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Transfer of grandfathered weapons is prohibited

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Ban on large capacity magazines beyond just ammunition for pistols

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Ban includes a 10-round limit (not a 15 or higher round limit)

rows.category: Assault weapons and large capacity ammunition magazines
rows.description: Pre-owned large capacity magazines are prohibited
Safety lock required for handguns sold through dealers
Safety lock required for handguns sold through private sellers
All firearms must be kept locked, all the time
Required locks must meet specified standards and/or must be approved
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns, regardless of whether child actually gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child gains access
Criminal liability for negligent storage of guns if child uses or carries the gun
Criminal liability for negligent storage applies regardless of whether gun is loaded or unloaded
Criminal liability applies to children less than 18 years old
Criminal liability applies to children less than 16 years old
Criminal liability applies to children less than 14 years old
All handguns sold must have either ballistic fingerprinting or microstamping so that they can be identified if used in a crime
State has a law that requires review of personalized gun technology
No stand your ground law
State law does not preempt local regulation of firearms
No law provides blanket immunity to gun manufacturers or prohibits state or local lawsuits against gun manufacturers
State law automatically prohibits misdemeanor crime of domestic violence (MCDV) offenders from possessing firearms
MCDV convictions are prohibiting if the victim is a dating partner of the offender
State law automatically requires MCDV offenders to surrender their firearms
No additional finding is required before the firearm surrender provisions apply
The surrender provisions apply if the defendant is a dating partner of the victim
State law allows law enforcement to remove firearms from MCDV offenders
State law requires law enforcement officers to remove firearms from MCDV offenders
State law requires law enforcement to remove firearms from the scene of a domestic violence incident
All firearms must be removed from the scene of a domestic violence incident
State law automatically prohibits domestic violence-related restraining order (DVRO) subjects from possessing firearms
DVROs are automatically prohibiting if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
Ex parte (temporary) DVRO subjects are automatically prohibited from possessing firearms
Ex parte DVROs are prohibiting if the petitioner is a dating partner of the DVRO subject
State law requires DVRO subjects to surrender their firearms
No additional finding is required before the firearm surrender provisions apply
The surrender provisions apply if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
State law requires ex parte DVRO subjects to surrender their firearms
No additional finding is required before the ex parte DVRO firearm surrender provisions apply
The ex parte DVRO surrender provisions apply if the subject is a dating partner of the petitioner
State law requires law enforcement officers to remove firearms from DVRO offenders automatically prohibited from possessing firearms
A stalking conviction is prohibitive for firearm possession
